physicist to observe natural phenomenon such a plasma star flame semiconductor without risk of exposure to radiation thus it be a very powerful tool available to physicist in it simplest form a spectrometer u a lens or mirror to produce a collimate beam of light and disperses it with a grate or a prism the disperse spectrum be then focus and view with an eyepiece or record with an electronic thus a discrete wavelength a 𝐸 ℎ𝑐 𝜆 be emit the emit wavelength due to transition from a high nth energy level to the low energy level p 2 be call the balmer transition wavelength where n be an integer the aim of our experiment be to investigate the colour of light observe in the hydrogen spectrum before calculate the rydberg constant find the rydberg constant ii theory the grate can be multiple m of 2π the path difference be d sinθ thus where m be the order number with order 0 be the centre of the fringe pattern rearrange equation 2. transition wavelength in hydrogen be give by the image 3. the telescope be move through precisely 90° and clamped in position 4. a grate be place in the grate holder and the grate table be turn until a reflect image of the entrance slit in the
